00056     /// @internal
00057     /// @namespace phys::internal
00058     /// @brief This namespace is used for internal helper classes, and in general it should be ignored by game developers
00059     /// @details This whole internal namespace is a dirty hack. This is where code goes that must implement classes or functions for the various subsytems the Physgame engine draws on.
00060     namespace internal
00061     {
00062         /// @internal
00063         /// @brief SDL uses this to filter events it presents to applications
00064         /// @details This is used used to filter out SQL_quit messages, and generate appropriate messages for the game developer to use.
00065         /// This will always drop quit events, and store that information for later use.
00066         /// @param event This is the event SDL expects use to filters, To get real data from this we setup it up so that if the event is a null pointer the function will return data about quit messages
00067         /// @warning Do not use this. It can only cause problems. This is for SDL, the user input subsystem, to filter certain events.
00068         /// @return This will always return either 0 or 1 to SDL. 0 if it should drop the event, which it does to all SDL_quit events, 1 if the event should be allowed, which it does to all events which are not SDL_quit events. If a null pointer was passed, then this will return 4 if it dropped an SDL_Quit, and 2 if it has not droppped an SDL_quit.
00069         int PhysSDLFilter( const RawEvent *event );
00070 
00071         //If this is passed an event that points to 0 it will function as a method to tell us if an SDL_QUIT message has been thrown
00072         //this will return 2 if it has not seen an SDL_quit, and a 4 if it has
00073         int PhysSDLFilter( const SDL_Event *event )
00074         {
00075             static bool DroppedQuit=false;
00076 
00077             if(event!=0)                //if this is a real event
00078             {
00079                 if ( event->type == SDL_QUIT )
00080                 {
00081                     DroppedQuit=true;   //Drop all quit events, and track that we dropped them
00082                     return 0;
00083                 }
00084                 return 1;
00085             }else{
00086                 if(DroppedQuit)         //4 if we need to make a quit event
00087                 {
00088                     DroppedQuit=false;  //Reset this so we don't add more in the future by accident
00089                     return 4;
00090                 }
00091                 return 2;
00092             }
00093         }
00094     } // /internal

00096     /// @todo TODO: Make the EventManager completely thread safe. IF this is completely thread safe, we can spawn numerous individual thread each accessing this and
00097     /// and the performance gain would almost scale directly with cpu core count increases. Look at boost scoped_lock
00098     EventManager::EventManager(World* ParentWorld_)
00099     {
00100         ParentWorld = ParentWorld_;
00101         PollMouseHor = false;
00102         PollMouseVert = false;
00103     }

00113     EventBase* EventManager::GetNextEvent()
00114     {
00115         if(EventQueue.size()==0)
00116         {
00117                 return 0;
00118         }
00119         EventBase* results = EventQueue.front();
00120         return results;
00121     }
00122 
00123     EventBase* EventManager::PopNextEvent()
00124     {
00125         if(EventQueue.size()==0)
00126         {
00127                 return 0;
00128         }
00129         EventBase* results = EventQueue.front();
00130         EventQueue.pop_front();
00131         return results;
00132     }
00133 
00134     void EventManager::RemoveNextEvent()
00135     {
00136         EventQueue.pop_front();
00137     }

00139     void EventManager::AddEvent(EventBase* EventToAdd)
00140     {
00141         EventQueue.push_back(EventToAdd);
00142     }

00151     void EventManager::UpdateEvents()
00152     {
00153         /// @todo There has got to be a more efficient way to do UpdateEvents()
00154         this->UpdateSystemEvents();
00155         this->UpdateUserInputEvents();
00156     }

00158     void EventManager::UpdateSystemEvents()
00159     {
00160         this->PreProcessSDLEvents();
00161         ParentWorld->Log("WM EventCount Pending:");
00162         ParentWorld->Log(SDL_WmEvents.size());
00163         /// @todo make Physevents for each of the events in SDL_WmEvents(and delete the SDL events)
00164     }
00165 
00166     void EventManager::UpdateUserInputEvents()
00167     {
00168         this->PreProcessSDLEvents();
00169         ParentWorld->Log("User Input EventCount Pending:");
00170         ParentWorld->Log(SDL_UserInputEvents.size());
00171 
00172         EventUserInput* FromSDLEvent = new EventUserInput();
00173         EventUserInput* FromSDLPolling = this->PollForUserInputEvents();
00174 
00175         while( !SDL_UserInputEvents.empty() )
00176         {
00177             RawEvent* CurrentRawEvent = SDL_UserInputEvents.front();
00178 
00179             FromSDLEvent->AddCodesFromRawEvent( *CurrentRawEvent );
00180             delete CurrentRawEvent;
00181             SDL_UserInputEvents.pop(); //NEXT!!!
00182         }
00183 
00184         *FromSDLEvent += *FromSDLPolling;
00185         delete FromSDLPolling;
00186 
00187         if (0 < FromSDLEvent->GetMetaCodeCount())
00188         {
00189             this->AddEvent(FromSDLEvent); //Now FromSDL is some else's responsibility
00190         }else{
00191             delete FromSDLEvent;
00192         }
00193     }

00198     EventBase* EventManager::GetNextSpecificEvent(EventBase::EventType SpecificType)
00199     {
00200         EventBase* results = 0;
00201         for(list<EventBase*>::iterator Iter = EventQueue.begin(); Iter!=EventQueue.end(); Iter++)
00202         {
00203             if((*Iter)->getEventType()==SpecificType)
00204             {
00205                 results = (*Iter);
00206                 return results;
00207             }
00208         }
00209         return results;
00210     }
00211 
00212     EventBase* EventManager::PopNextSpecificEvent(EventBase::EventType SpecificType)
00213     {
00214         EventBase* results = 0;
00215         for(list<EventBase*>::iterator Iter = EventQueue.begin(); Iter!=EventQueue.end(); Iter++)
00216         {
00217             if((*Iter)->getEventType()==SpecificType)
00218             {
00219                 results = (*Iter);
00220                 EventQueue.erase(Iter);
00221                 return results;
00222             }
00223         }
00224         return results;
00225     }

00227     void EventManager::RemoveNextSpecificEvent(EventBase::EventType SpecificType)
00228     {
00229         for(list<EventBase*>::iterator Iter = EventQueue.begin(); Iter!=EventQueue.end(); Iter++)
00230         {
00231             if((*Iter)->getEventType()==SpecificType)
00232             {
00233                 EventQueue.erase(Iter);
00234             }
00235         }
00236     }

00238     list<EventBase*>* EventManager::GetAllSpecificEvents(EventBase::EventType SpecificType)
00239     {
00240         list<EventBase*>* TempList = new list<EventBase*>;
00241 
00242         for(list<EventBase*>::iterator Iter = EventQueue.begin(); Iter!=EventQueue.end(); Iter++)
00243         {
00244             if((*Iter)->getEventType()==SpecificType)
00245             {
00246                 TempList->push_back(*Iter);
00247             }
00248         }
00249         return TempList;
00250     }
00251 
00252     void EventManager::RemoveAllSpecificEvents(EventBase::EventType SpecificType)
00253     {
00254         for(list<EventBase*>::iterator Iter = EventQueue.begin(); Iter!=EventQueue.end(); Iter++)
00255         {
00256             if((*Iter)->getEventType()==SpecificType)
00257             {
00258                 this->EventQueue.remove(*Iter);
00259             }
00260         }
00261     }

00281     list<EventRenderTime*>* EventManager::GetAllRenderTimeEvents()
00282     {
00283         list<EventBase*>* TempList = this->GetAllSpecificEvents(EventBase::UserInput);
00284         list<EventRenderTime*>* Results= new list<EventRenderTime*>;
00285 
00286         for(list<EventBase*>::iterator Iter = TempList->begin(); Iter!=TempList->end(); Iter++)
00287         {
00288             Results->push_back( dynamic_cast<EventRenderTime*> (*Iter) );
00289         }
00290 
00291         return Results;
00292     }

00359     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00360     // Polling Functions

00362 
00363     void EventManager::AddPollingCheck(const MetaCode &InputToTryPolling)
00364     {
00365         bool ItFailed = true;
00366 
00367         //Check for keyboard code
00368         if ( MetaCode::KEY_LAST > InputToTryPolling.GetCode() && InputToTryPolling.GetCode() > MetaCode::KEY_FIRST)
00369         {
00370             this->WatchKeyboardKeys.push_back(InputToTryPolling.GetCode());
00371             ItFailed=false;
00372         }
00373 
00374         //if it is a specific mouse button, then
00375         if ( MetaCode::MOUSEBUTTON == InputToTryPolling.GetCode())
00376         {
00377             this->WatchMouseKeys.push_back(InputToTryPolling.GetID());
00378             ItFailed=false;
00379         }
00380 
00381         //Mouse Movement
00382         if ( MetaCode::MOUSEABSOLUTEVERTICAL == InputToTryPolling.GetCode())
00383         {
00384             PollMouseVert = true;
00385             ItFailed=false;
00386         }
00387         if ( MetaCode::MOUSEABSOLUTEHORIZONTAL == InputToTryPolling.GetCode())
00388         {
00389             PollMouseHor = true;
00390             ItFailed=false;
00391         }
00392 
00393         if (ItFailed)
00394             this->ParentWorld->LogAndThrow("Unsupported Polling Check on this Platform");
00395     }
00396 
00397     void EventManager::RemovePollingCheck(const MetaCode &InputToStopPolling)
00398     {
00399         bool ItFailed = true; // who cares why it failed, it did, and should be reported
00400         bool supported = false; //used to help determine if the metacode passed in was nonsense or could have been valid
00401 
00402         //Check for keyboard code
00403         if ( MetaCode::KEY_LAST > InputToStopPolling.GetCode() && InputToStopPolling.GetCode() > MetaCode::KEY_FIRST)
00404         {
00405             supported=true;
00406 
00407             vector<MetaCode::InputCode>::iterator KeyIter;
00408             for(KeyIter = this->WatchKeyboardKeys.begin(); KeyIter!=this->WatchKeyboardKeys.end(); KeyIter++) //Check Each
00409             {
00410                 if( *KeyIter == InputToStopPolling.GetCode())
00411                 {
00412                     this->WatchKeyboardKeys.erase(KeyIter);
00413                     ItFailed=false;
00414                 }
00415             }
00416         }
00417 
00418         //if it is a specific mouse button, then
00419         if ( MetaCode::MOUSEBUTTON == InputToStopPolling.GetCode())
00420         {
00421             supported=true;
00422 
00423             vector<int>::iterator MouseIter;
00424             for(MouseIter = this->WatchMouseKeys.begin(); MouseIter!=this->WatchMouseKeys.end(); MouseIter++) //Check Each
00425             {
00426                 if( *MouseIter == InputToStopPolling.GetCode())
00427                 {
00428                     this->WatchMouseKeys.erase(MouseIter);
00429                     ItFailed=false;
00430                 }
00431             }
00432         }
00433 
00434         //Mouse Movement
00435         if ( MetaCode::MOUSEABSOLUTEVERTICAL == InputToStopPolling.GetCode())
00436         {
00437             supported=true;
00438             if(PollMouseVert == true)
00439                 {ItFailed=false;}
00440             PollMouseVert = false;
00441 
00442         }
00443 
00444         if ( MetaCode::MOUSEABSOLUTEHORIZONTAL == InputToStopPolling.GetCode())
00445         {
00446             supported=true;
00447             if(PollMouseHor == true)
00448                 {ItFailed=false;}
00449             PollMouseHor = false;
00450         }
00451 
00452         if (!supported)
00453             this->ParentWorld->LogAndThrow("Unsupported Polling Check on this Platform, Cannot Remove");
00454         if (ItFailed)
00455             this->ParentWorld->LogAndThrow("Polling Check did not exist, Cannot Remove");
00456     }

00459     EventUserInput* EventManager::PollForUserInputEvents()
00460     {
00461         vector<MetaCode> MetaBag;
00462 
00463         //Call the private Polling routines
00464         PollKeyboard(MetaBag);
00465         PollMouseButtons(MetaBag);
00466         PollMouseLocation(MetaBag);
00467 
00468         EventUserInput* test = new EventUserInput(MetaBag);
00469         return test;
00470     }
00471 
00472     //Internal private Polling routine
00473     void EventManager::PollKeyboard(vector<MetaCode> &CodeBag)
00474     {
00475         if(this->WatchKeyboardKeys.size()>0)
00476         {
00477             int* KeyCount = 0;
00478             Uint8* KeyboardSnapshot = SDL_GetKeyState(KeyCount);
00479 
00480             vector<MetaCode::InputCode>::iterator iter;
00481             for(iter = this->WatchKeyboardKeys.begin(); iter != (this->WatchKeyboardKeys.end()) ; iter++)
00482             {
00483                 if( *iter < MetaCode::KEY_LAST )//Is it a valid keycode
00484                 {
00485                     if(KeyboardSnapshot[*iter]) // is it up or down
00486                     {//down
00487                         MetaCode temp(MetaCode::BUTTON_DOWN,0,*iter);
00488                         CodeBag.push_back(temp);
00489                     }else{//up
00490                         MetaCode temp(MetaCode::BUTTON_UP,0,*iter);
00491                         CodeBag.push_back(temp);
00492                     }
00493                 }
00494             }
00495         }
00496     }
00497 
00498     //Internal private Polling routine
00499     void EventManager::PollMouseButtons(vector<MetaCode> &CodeBag)
00500     {
00501         if(this->WatchMouseKeys.size()>0)
00502         {
00503             vector<int>::iterator iter;
00504             for(iter = this->WatchMouseKeys.begin(); iter != (this->WatchMouseKeys.end()) ; iter++)
00505             {
00506                 if(SDL_GetMouseState(NULL, NULL)&SDL_BUTTON(*iter))
00507                 {
00508                         MetaCode temp(MetaCode::BUTTON_DOWN,*iter,MetaCode::MOUSEBUTTON);
00509                         CodeBag.push_back(temp);
00510                 }else{
00511                         MetaCode temp(MetaCode::BUTTON_UP,*iter,MetaCode::MOUSEBUTTON);
00512                         CodeBag.push_back(temp);
00513                 }
00514             }
00515         }
00516 
00517     }
00518 
00519     void EventManager::PollMouseLocation(vector<MetaCode> &CodeBag)
00520     {
00521         if( PollMouseHor || PollMouseVert )
00522         {
00523             int Vert=0;
00524             int Hor=0;
00525             SDL_GetMouseState(&Hor, &Vert);
00526             if( PollMouseVert )
00527             {
00528                 MetaCode temp(Vert,0,MetaCode::MOUSEABSOLUTEVERTICAL);
00529                 CodeBag.push_back(temp);
00530             }
00531             if( PollMouseHor )
00532             {
00533                 MetaCode temp(Hor,0,MetaCode::MOUSEABSOLUTEHORIZONTAL);
00534                 CodeBag.push_back(temp);
00535             }
00536         }
00537     }
00538 
00539     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00540     // Standard interupt basd user input
00541 
00542     //This function will get all the events from SDL and Sort them into one of two Queues
00543     void EventManager::PreProcessSDLEvents()
00544     {
00545         UpdateQuitEvents(); //quit skips the preprocessing Queue and goes straight into the the main Queue
00546 
00547         RawEvent temp;
00548         RawEvent* FromSDL=&temp;
00549         while(SDL_PollEvent(FromSDL))
00550         {
00551             RawEvent* ScopeHolder = new RawEvent;
00552             *ScopeHolder = temp;
00553             switch(FromSDL->type)
00554             {
00555                 case SDL_ACTIVEEVENT:   //when the window gains focus
00556                 case SDL_VIDEORESIZE:   //when the screen is resized
00557                 case SDL_VIDEOEXPOSE:   //when the windows goes from being hidden to being shown
00558                 case SDL_QUIT:          //when SDL closes
00559                 case SDL_SYSWMEVENT:
00560                     SDL_WmEvents.push(ScopeHolder);
00561                     break;
00562                 case SDL_KEYDOWN:
00563                 case SDL_KEYUP:
00564                 case SDL_MOUSEMOTION:
00565                 case SDL_MOUSEBUTTONDOWN:
00566                 case SDL_MOUSEBUTTONUP:
00567                 case SDL_JOYAXISMOTION:
00568                 case SDL_JOYBUTTONDOWN:
00569                 case SDL_JOYBUTTONUP:
00570                 case SDL_JOYBALLMOTION:
00571                 case SDL_JOYHATMOTION:
00572                     SDL_UserInputEvents.push(ScopeHolder);
00573                     break;
00574                 case SDL_USEREVENT://Never thrown by SDL, but could be added by a user
00575                 default:
00576                     throw ("Unknown SDL Event Inserted");
00577                     break;
00578             }
00579         }
00580     }
00581 
00582     void EventManager::UpdateQuitEvents()
00583     {
00584         if (NULL == SDL_GetEventFilter())           //Verify the Event filter is installed, if not, then install it.
00585         {
00586             SDL_SetEventFilter( internal::PhysSDLFilter );
00587         }else{
00588             if(4==internal::PhysSDLFilter(0))                 //Pass it a null pointer to get it to "Not Callback Mode"
00589             {
00590                 this->AddEvent(new EventQuit());    //We need to make a quit event
00591             }else{
00592                 //all clear
00593             }
00594         }
00595     }
